alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Lawrence (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 2:22PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Lawrence and southeastern Crawford Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 222 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chauncey, or near Lawrenceville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lawrenceville around 230 PM CDT. Birds around 235 PM CDT. Flat Rock around 240 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Russellville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
